page.title: 12Disused Railway Line,Rugby
page.content: Grid ref.516730_513713 { The Great Central Railway}opened in 1899.It became part of the{London {North Eastern Railway}in the 1923 Grouping. It closed,south of Rugby,in 1966, after the 1962 Beeching Report.The final section,from Rugby to Nottingham closed in 1969. The line is now owned by the Rugby Borough Council and various farmers. The area includes a leisure walk and farmland. Railway evidence today includes :- earthworks (cuttings and embankments); ballast stones;bases of plate layers' huts;support wires from telegraph poles and signals,in the embankments. There are also bridges,both intact and with their tops removed. Nature now reduces the original double track width to one.
